meanings.definition: Sensory receptors located in muscles, tendons, and joints that provide information about body position and movement.
meanings.sent1: During exercise, proprioceptors in the muscles send signals to the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study proprioceptors to understand how our bodies sense movement.
meanings.sent3: The proprioceptors in the joints must be good at their job to keep us from falling over!
meanings.sent4: Her proprioceptors acted like tiny detectives, always reporting on her body's every move.
meanings.sent5: Imagine proprioceptors as tiny messengers constantly updating the brain on where each body part is.

meanings.definition: Proprioceptors help the body maintain balance and coordination.
meanings.sent1: When dancing, our proprioceptors work hard to keep us from stumbling.
meanings.sent2: Athletes rely on their proprioceptors to stay agile and coordinated during games.
meanings.sent3: The proprioceptors must throw a party every time we manage to stay balanced on one foot!
meanings.sent4: Her proprioceptors were like skilled acrobats, always keeping her body in perfect balance.
meanings.sent5: The proprioceptors are like the body's own internal GPS, guiding us through every movement.

meanings.definition: The brain uses information from proprioceptors to control muscle movement.
meanings.sent1: Proprioceptors help the brain make quick decisions during physical activities.
meanings.sent2: The brain relies on proprioceptors to adjust muscle movements based on feedback.
meanings.sent3: The brain must be grateful for the constant updates from the proprioceptors!
meanings.sent4: Her proprioceptors were like loyal messengers, always delivering crucial information to the brain.
meanings.sent5: The proprioceptors are like the brain's secret agents, ensuring smooth communication with the muscles.
